items.content_html: I am the lead developper of the Ergodic Design project, a commercial branch to Kairos Research. Its mandate is to help social systems build an appropriate understanding of their reality, and therefore make their experience subjectively predictable (ergodic). In time, our activity will ecompass systems management lessons, counsel for collective intelligence, augmented intelligence systems, and embodied artificial intelligence. I also do interventions and conferences for the French Society of Cliodynamics, as well as systems modelling and scientific tutoring on systems science. Feel free to contact me if I could be of any help to your project !

items.title: Creation
items.summary: I have spend the last few years building the outline of an uchronical fiction on spirituality, power, and history. It is constituted by…
items.content_html:
I have spend the last few years building the outline of an uchronical fiction on spirituality, power, and history. It is constituted by a web of related stories collectively drafting the progressive institution of a neognostic Temple of Tyr as an hegemonic geopolitical power and its consequent desintegration into internal warfare. Each story captures how a specific actor participates in this trajectory, and seeks to convey how their particular perspective derive from but also participate in shaping historical dynamics beyond their all too human compehension.

The central goal of this project is to convey at an intimate level how power derives ultimately from the renunciation to control. All characters become entangled to some level in the Temple’s affairs, and their unbalances are turend into leverages to bring them into the role they are expected to fulfill. The Temple’s institutions, the strategies and attitudes of its militant, the esoteric doctrine they practice and the exoteric doctrine they prache progressively reveal its underlying ethics, which holds the ability to shape the material world through spiritual power as the only kind of virtue.

Exerpts will be published as I see fit.

items.title: Research
items.summary: My main interest is to study the dynamics of creative evolution and multi-scale organization in complex adaptive systems, such as woodlice and human…
items.content_html:
My main interest is to study the dynamics of creative evolution and multi-scale organization in complex adaptive systems, such as woodlice and human societies. The core insight I draw upon is that such system are constrained by their material organization, their history, and the context of those operation, but ultimately lack a “natural” state space enabling a full representation of their possible states of organization. Therefore, they are poised on the verge of a space of adjacent possibles, as their state space continuously evolves as a result of their own activity.

This basic constatation motivate the formulation of multiple, although deeply interwoven, questions.

  • Epistemologically, what does it mean to measure and explain features of creative evolution ?
    • Guénin–Carlut, Avel. 2020. ‘Cognition in Eco, Cognition in Vitro - Measurement and Explanation in Cognitive Science’. https://osf.io/ercz6/ (February 11, 2022).
  • Sociologically, how do new forms of organization emerge in human history, and how do they constraint future evolution ?
    • *Guénin—Carlut, Avel. 2022. “Thinking like a State : Embodied Intelligence in the Deep History of Our Collective Mind.” IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering 1261 (1): 012026. https://doi.org/10.1088/1757-899X/1261/1/012026.
  • Computationally, how and why model the dynamics of creative evolution in collective systems ?
    • Guénin–Carlut, Avel. 2022. ‘Cognitive Agency in Sociocultural Evolution’. https://osf.io/x7yr4/ (January 14, 2022).
  • Formally, how to represent creative evolution ?
    • Guénin–Carlut, Avel. 2022. “Physics of Creation - Symmetry Breaking, (En)Active Inference, and Unfolding Statespaces.” OSF Preprints. https://doi.org/10.31219/osf.io/68947.

Current status

  • PhD student on Mind & Material Culture at the University of Sussex, under the supervision of Andy Clark and Chris Buckley, as a part of the XSCAPE project.
  • Researcher for Kairos Research
  • Scientific advisor for the Active Inference Institute

Ongoing projects

  • From the existential stance to social constraints. Research project. Role: Research coordinator. Goal: Exposing the role of embodied synchronisation and explicit theory of mind in the development of social constraints (such as norms or affordances), and their ability to enact social regulation.
  • Active Inference and collective intelligence. Active Inference Institute community project. Role: Scientific advisor. Goal: Developping an Active Inference approach to the nature and development of intelligence in collective systems, such as neuron network or human collectives.

items.title: About me
items.summary: I work at the interface of physics and philosophy aiming to developp a radically integrated understanding of life, cognition, and culture under the…
items.content_html:
I work at the interface of physics and philosophy aiming to developp a radically integrated understanding of life, cognition, and culture under the physics of self-organizing, “creative” systems. I seek to discover why particular systems create meaning, how to represent that process mathematically / computationnally, and what it means for the evolution of the universe and of human societies. I am currently employed as a PhD student working on the co-evolution of the human mind and material culture under the supervision of Andy Clark and Chris Buckley.

I’m also a coordinator for Kairos Research, participative research & scientific mediation collective which focuses on buildingsituated knowledge for us to navigate ongoing socio-historical dynamics. We do so by synthesing pre-existent complexity-oriented approaches to social sciences, but also by developping a political epistemology that is thoroughly grounded on the dynamics of living and cognitive systems. We also aim to build a research-action cooperative tmandated to enact governance systems and actors network that can navigate real world complexity and withstand the constraints of the Anthropocene.

I have a broader commitment to reveal what’s below sensible reality and beyond the means of our linguistic grasp. This is why I’m interested in various ways to convey meaning without the need for formal language, from (classical) graphical design to creative ventures. I am especially interested in exploring the ethics of impermanence through graphism and fiction. I write stories exploring how actors struggling to impose meaning onto a shifting and ultimately inaccessible reality, and how this process ultimately shapes the evolution of human societies.

You can find me on OSF, Github, or contact me by mail. If you like my work or I helped you in some way, please consider making a donation via LiberaPay or Ko-Fi.
